text: INTRODUCTION
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: IT is six hundred and fifty years since Chretien de Troyes wrote
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his Cliges. And yet he is wonderfully near us, whereas he is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: separated by a great gulf from the rude trouveres of the Chansons
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: de Gestes and from the Anglo-Saxon Chronicle, which was still
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: dragging out its weary length in his early days. Chretien is as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: refined, as civilised, as composite as we are ourselves; his
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: ladies are as full of whims, impulses, sudden reserves,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: self-debate as M. Paul Bourget's heroines; while the problems of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: conscience and of emotion which confront them are as complex as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: those presented on the modern stage. Indeed, there is no break
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: between the Breton romance and the psychological-analytical novel
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of our own day.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Whence comes this amazing modernity and complexity? From many
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: sources:--Provencal love-lore, Oriental subtlety, and Celtic
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: mysticism--all blended by that marvellous dexterity, style,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: malice, and measure which are so utterly French that English has
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: no adequate words for them. We said "Celtic mysticism," but there
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: is something else about Chretien which is also Celtic, though
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: very far from being "mystic". We talk a great deal nowadays about
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Celtic melancholy, Celtic dreaminess, Celtic "other-worldliness";
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and we forget the qualities that made Caesar's Gauls, St. Paul's
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Galatians, so different from the grave and steadfast Romans--that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: loud Gaulois that has made the Parisian the typical Frenchman. A
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: different being, this modern Athenian, from the mystic Irish
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: peasant we see in the poetic modern Irish drama!--and yet both
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: are Celts.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Not much "other-worldliness" about Chretien. He is as positive as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: any man can be. His is not of the world of Saint Louis, of the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Crusaders, of the Cathedral-builders. In Cliges there is no
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: religious atmosphere at all. We hear scarcely anything of Mass,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of bishops, of convents. When he mentions Tierce or Prime, it is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: merely to tell us the hour at which something happened--and this
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: something is never a religious service. There is nothing behind
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the glamour of arms and love, except for the cas de conscience
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: presented by the lovers. Nothing but names and framework are
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Celtic; the spirit, with its refinements and its hair-splitting,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: is Provencal. But what a brilliant whole! what art! what measure!
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Our thoughts turn to the gifted women of the age--as subtle, as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: interesting, and as unscrupulous as the women of the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Renaissance--to Eleanor of Aquitaine, a reigning princess, a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: troubadour, a Crusader, the wife of two kings, the mother of two
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: kings, to the last, intriguing and pulling the strings of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: political power--"An Ate, stirring him [King John] to blood and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: strife."
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: The twelfth century was an age in which women had full scope--in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: which the Empress Maud herself took the field against her foe, in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: which Stephen's queen seized a fortress, in which a wife could
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: move her husband to war or to peace, in which a Marie of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Champagne (Eleanor's daughter) could set the tone of great poets
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and choose their subjects.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: If, then, this woman-worship, this complexity of love, this
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: self-debating, first comes into literature with Chretien de
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Troyes, and is still with us, no more interesting work exists
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: than his earliest masterpiece, Cliges. The delicate and reticent
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Soredamors; the courteous and lovable, Guinevere; the proud and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: passionate Fenice, who will not sacrifice her fair fame and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: chastity; the sorceress Thessala, ancestress of Juliet's
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: nurse--these form a gallery of portraits unprecedented in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: literature.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: The translator takes this opportunity of thanking Mr. B. J.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Hayes, M.A., of St. John's College, Cambridge, for occasional
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: help, and also for kindly reading the proofs.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: CLIGES
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: THE clerk who wrote the tale of Erec and Enid, and translated the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Commandments of Ovid and the Art of Love, and composed the Bite
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of the Shoulder, and sang of King Mark and of the blonde Iseult,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and of the metamorphosis of the Hoopoe and of the Swallow and of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the Nightingale, is now beginning a new tale of a youth who was
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: in Greece of the lineage of King Arthur. But before I tell you
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: anything of him, you shall hear his father's life--whence he was
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and of what lineage. So valiant was he and of such proud spirit,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that to win worth and praise he went from Greece to England,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: which was then called Britain. We find this story that I desire
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to tell and to relate to you, recorded in one of the books of the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: library of my lord Saint Peter at Beauvais. Thence was taken the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: tale from which Chretien framed this romance. The book, which
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: truthfully bears witness to the story, is very ancient; for this
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: reason it is all the more to be believed. From the books which we
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: possess, we know the deeds of the ancients and of the world which
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: aforetime was. This our books have taught us: that Greece had the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: first renown in chivalry and in learning. Then came chivalry to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Rome, and the heyday of learning, which now is come into France.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: God grant that she be maintained there; and that her home there
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: please her so much that never may depart from France the honour
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: which has there taken up its abode. God had lent that glory to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: others; but no man talks any longer either more or less about
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Greeks and Romans; talk of them has ceased, and the bright glow
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: is extinct.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Chretien begins his tale--as the story relates to us--which tells
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of an emperor mighty in wealth and honour, who ruled Greece and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Constantinople. There was a very noble empress by whom the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: emperor had two children. But the first was of such an age before
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the other was born, that if he had willed he might have become a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: knight and held all the empire. The first was named Alexander;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the younger was called Alis. The father too had for name
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Alexander; and the mother had for name Tantalis. I will
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: straight-away leave speaking of the empress Tantalis, of the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: emperor, and of Alis. I will speak to you of Alexander, who was
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: so great-hearted and proud that he did not stoop to become a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: knight in his own realm. He had heard mention made of King
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Arthur, who was reigning at that time; and of the barons which he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: ever maintained in his retinue wherefore his Court was feared and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: famed throughout the world. Howe'er the end may fall out for him,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and whate'er may come of it for the lad, there is nought that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: will hold him from his yearning to go to Britain; but it is meet
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that he take leave of his father before he goes to Britain or to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Cornwall. Alexander the fair, the valiant, goes to speak to the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: emperor in order to ask permission and to take his leave. Now
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: will he tell him what is his vow, and what he would fain do and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: take in hand. "Fair sire, that I may be schooled in honour and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: win worth and renown, a boon," quoth he, "I venture to crave of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: you--a boon that I would have you give me; never defer it now for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: me if you are destined to grant it." The emperor had no thought
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of being vexed for that, either much or little; he is bound to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: desire and to covet honour for his son above aught else. He would
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: deem himself to be acting well--would deem? ay, and he would be
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: so acting--if he increased his son's honour. "Fair son," quoth
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he, "I grant you your good pleasure, and tell me what you would
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have me give you." Now the lad has done his work well; and right
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: glad was he of it when is granted him the boon that he so longed
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to have. "Sire," quoth he, "would you know what you have promised
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: me? I wish to have in great store of your gold and of your silver
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and comrades from your retinue such as I shall will to choose;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: for I wish to go forth from your empire, and I shall go to offer
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: my service to the king who reigns over Britain, that he may dub
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: me knight. Never, indeed, on any day as long as I live shall I
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: wear visor on my face or helm on my head, I warrant you, till
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: King Arthur gird on my sword if he deign to do it; for I will
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: receive arms of no other." The emperor without more ado replies:
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: "Fair son, in God's name, say not so. This land and mighty are
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: diverse and contrary. And that man is a slave. Constantinople is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: wholly yours. You must not hold me a niggard when I would fain
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: give you so fair a boon. Soon will I have you crowned; and a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: knight shall you be to-morrow. All Greece shall be in your hand;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and you shall receive from your barons--as indeed you ought to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: receive--their oaths and homage. He who refuses this is no wise
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: man."
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: The lad hears the promise--namely, that his father will dub him
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: knight on the morrow after Mass--but says that he will prove
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: himself coward or hero in another land than his own. "If you will
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: grant my boon in that matter in which I have asked you; then give
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: me fur both grey and of divers colour and good steeds and silken
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: attire; for before I am knight I will fain serve King Arthur. Not
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: yet have I so great valour that I can bear arms. None by entreaty
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: or by fair words could persuade me not to go into the foreign
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: land to see the king and his barons, whose renown for courtesy
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and for prowess is so great. Many high men through their idleness
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lose great praise that they might have if they wandered o'er the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: world. Repose and praise agree all together, as it seems to me;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: for a man of might who is ever resting in no wise becomes famous.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Prowess is a burden to a cowardly man; and cowardice is a burden
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to the brave; thus the twain to his possessions who is ever
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: heaping them up and increasing them. Fair sire, as long as I am
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: allowed to win renown, if I can avail so much, I will give my
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: pains and diligence to it."
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: At this, without doubt, the emperor feels joy and anxiety--joy
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: has he; for that he perceives that his son aims at valiant deeds;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and anxiety on the other hand, for that he is leaving him. But
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: because of the promise that he has made him it behoves him to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: grant his boon whatever anxiety he feel about it; for an emperor
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: must not lie. "Fair son," quoth he, "I ought not to fail to do
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: your pleasure, since I see that you aspire to honour. You may
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: take from my treasury two barques full of gold and silver; but
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: take care that you be very generous and courteous and well-bred."
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Now is the youth right glad; for his father promises him so much
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that he puts his treasure at his free disposal and exhorts and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: commands him to give and to spend liberally; and also he tells
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him the reason wherefore: "Fair son," quoth he, "believe me in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: this; that open-handedness is the lady and queen who illumines
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: all virtues; and it is not a whit difficult to prove this. In
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: what place could one find a man, however mighty and magnificent
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he be, that is not blamed if he be a niggard; or any man, however
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: ill-reputed he be, whom liberality does not render praised?
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Liberality of itself makes a man of honour--which neither high
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Rank, nor courtesy, nor knowledge, nor noble birth, nor wealth,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: nor strength, nor chivalry, nor courage, nor lordship, nor
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: beauty, nor any other thing, can do. But just as the rose is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: fairer than any other flower when she buddeth fresh and new; so
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: where liberality comes she holds herself above all virtues, and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: she multiplies five hundredfold the virtues that she finds in an
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: honourable man who proves his worth. There is so much to say
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: about liberality that I could not tell the half of it." Well has
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the lad succeeded in whatsoever he has requested and asked; for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his father has found for him all that his desire conceived.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: which her son must needs follow; but whoever has grief and
title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: blames and dissuades him, the youth as quickly as he could bade
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his ships be got ready; for he had no wish to stay longer in his
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: own country. The ships were loaded that night by his command with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: wine with meat and with biscuits.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: The ships are loaded in the harbour and on the morrow with great
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: comrades who were fain of the journey. The emperor convoys him
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and the empress who was sad at heart. In the harbour they find
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the mariners in the ships beside the cliff. The sea was peaceful
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and smooth the wind gentle and the air serene. Alexander first of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: all, when he had parted from his father and on taking leave of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the empress whose heart was sad within her, enters from the boat
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: into the ship and his comrades with him. Four, three, and two,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they simultaneously strive to enter without delay. Full soon was
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

text: watch their sorrow as far as they can see them. They gaze at
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their own sorrow in sooth; for great is their sorrow for the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lads: may God lead them to port without disaster and without
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: peril!
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: They were at sea all April and part of May. Without great peril
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and without alarm they made land above Southampton. One day
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: 'twixt Nones and Vespers they cast anchor and have made the port.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: The youths, who had never previously learned to suffer discomfort
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: or pain, had stayed on the sea which was not wholesome for them
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: so long that all are pale and all the strongest and most healthy
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: are weakened and nerveless. And, nevertheless, they show great
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: joy; for that they have escaped from the sea and come hither
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: where they would be. And because they were suffering greatly,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they lie that night above Southampton and show great joy and let
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: ask and inquire whether the king is in England. They are told
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that he is at Winchester; and that they can be there full soon if
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they will depart with morning provided that they keep to the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: right way. This news pleases them well; and on the morrow, when
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the day is born, the lads wake up with morning and equip and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: prepare themselves. And when they were equipped they have turned
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: from above Southampton and have kept to the right way till they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have reached Winchester where the king was tarrying. Before Prime
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the Greeks had come to Court. They dismount at the foot of the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: steps, the squires and the horses stayed in the court below; and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the youths ascend to the presence of the best king that ever was
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: or ever may be in the world. And when the king sees them come,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they please and delight him much; but ere they had come before
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him, they throw off the cloaks from their necks that they might
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: not be taken for clowns. Thus all having thrown off their cloaks
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have come before the king. And the barons one and all keep
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: silence; for the youths please them mightily for that they see
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them fair and comely. Never do they dream that they are all sons
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of counts or of a king; yet truly so they were, and they were in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the flower of their youth, comely and well set up in body; and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the robes that they wore were of one cloth and one cut, of one
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: appearance and one colour. Twelve were they without their lord of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: whom I will tell you this much without more ado; that none was
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: better than he; but without arrogance and yet unabashed he stood
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: with his mantle off before the king, and was very fair and well
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: shaped. He has kneeled down before him, and all the others from
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: courtesy, kneel beside their lord.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Alexander, whose tongue was sharpened to speak well and wisely,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: greets the king. "King," quoth he, "if renown lie not concerning
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: you since God made the first man, no king with faith in God was
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: born so powerful as you. King, the report that is in men's mouths
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: has brought me to your Court to serve and honour you, and if my
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: service is pleasing I will stay till I be a new-made knight at
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: your hand, not at that of another. For never shall I be dubbed
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: knight if I be not so by you. If my service so please you that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: you will to make me a knight, keep me, gracious king, and my
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: comrades who are here." Straightway the king replies: "Friend,"
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: quoth he, "I reject not a whit either you or your company; but ye
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: are all right welcome; for ye have the air, I well think it, of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: being sons of men of high rank. Whence are ye?" "We are from
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Greece." "From Greece?" "Truly are we." "Who is thy father?"
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: "Faith, sire, the emperor." "And what is thy name, fair friend?"
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: "Alexander was the name given me when I received salt and chrism
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and Christianity and baptism." "Alexander, fair dear friend, I
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: keep you right willingly; and much does it please and joy me, for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: you have done me exceeding great honour in that you are come to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: my Court. It is my good pleasure that you be honoured here as a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: noble warrior, wise and gentle. Too long have you been on your
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: knees: rise, I bid you, and henceforth be free of my Court and of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: me; for you have arrived at  a good haven."
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Forthwith the Greeks rise. Blithe are they for that the king has
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: thus courteously kept them. Alexander is welcome; for there is no
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lack of aught that he wishes nor is there any baron in the Court
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: so high that he does not speak him fair and welcome him. For he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: is not foolish nor boastful nor doth he vaunt his noble birth. He
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: makes himself known to Sir Gawain and to the others one by one.
title: Cliges: A Romance

text: much that he hails him as friend and comrade. The Greeks had
title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: diligently the emperor's advice and counsel--namely, that he

text: should have his heart wide-awake to give and to spend liberally.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: He gives great diligence and pains thereto. He lives well at his
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lodging and gives and spends liberally as it beseems his wealth,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he had brought from his land. So much trouble has Alexander given
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: himself, and so much has he prevailed by his fair service, that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the king loves and esteems him dearly as well the barons and the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: queen.

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: England, who may keep and maintain it in peace. By the Council it

text: Windsor; for till then they deemed no baron more loyal in all the
title: Cliges: A Romance

text: king's land. When this man had the land in his power, King Arthur

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: folk hear tell that the king and his barons are coming: the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Bretons rejoice greatly thereat.

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: tell of a man whom she could deign to love however much beauty

text: prowess dominion or high rank he had. And yet the damsel was so

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: bend her mind thereto. Now will Love make her sorrowful; and Love

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: thinks to avenge himself right well for the great pride and
title: Cliges: A Romance

text: resistance which she has always shown to him. Right well has Love

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: aimed; for he has stricken her in the heart with his arrow. Oft

text: she grows pale; oft the beads of sweat break out, and in spite of

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: towards Alexander; but she must needs guard herself against my
title: Cliges: A Romance

text: Lord Gawain her brother. Dearly does she buy and pay for her

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: great pride and her disdain. Love has heated for her a bath which
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: mightily inflames and enkindles her. Now is he kind to her, now
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: cruel; now she wants him, and now she rejects him. She accuses

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: her eyes of treachery and says: "Eyes, you have betrayed me.

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Through you has my heart which was wont to be faithful conceived

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: hatred for me. Now does what I see bring grief. Grief? Nay, in

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: truth, but rather pleasure. And if I see aught that grieves me,

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: still have I not my eyes under my own sway? My strength must
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: cannot control my eyes and make them look elsewhere. By so doing

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: I shall be able to guard myself right well from Love, who wishes

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to be my master. What the eye sees not the heart does not lament.

text: drawing my eyes he has done me no wrong of which I can complain;
title: Cliges: A Romance

text: with the eyes. And what wrong, then, have my eyes done to me if

text: commit? Ought I to blame them? Nay. Whom, then? Myself, who have

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of a will whence grief may come to me. If I can? Fool, what have

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: First will I tell you of Alexander: how he complains and laments.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Love brings before his mind the lady for whose sake he feels such
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Sorrow; for she has robbed him of his heart, and will not let him
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: rest in his bed; so much it delights him to recall the beauty and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the mien of her as to whom he dare not hope that ever joy of her
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: may fall to his lot. "I may hold myself a fool," quoth he. "A
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: fool? Truly am I a fool, since I do not dare to say what I think;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: for quickly would it turn to my bane. I have set my thought on
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: folly. Then is it not better for me to meditate in silence than
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

text: if he does not seek that by which he may have health if he can

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: find it anywhere; but many a one thinks to gain his own advantage

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Cannot? Methinks I have lied. As soon as I first felt this evil,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance
