text: any one had cared to value or to sell it--as the arms of all the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: other twelve together. Straightway by the sea they disrobed and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: washed and bathed; for they neither wished nor deigned that any
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: other bath should be heated for them. They made the sea their
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: bath and tub.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: The queen, who does not hate Alexander--rather does she love and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: praise and prize him much--hears of the matter. She wills to do
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him a great service; it is far greater than she thinks. She
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: searches and empties all her chests till she has drawn forth a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: shirt of white silk very well wrought very delicate and very
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: fine. There was no thread in the seams that was not of gold, or
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: at the least of silver. Soredamors from time to time had set her
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: hands to the sewing, and had in places sewn in beside the gold a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: hair from her head, both on the two sleeves and on the collar to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: see and to put to the test whether she could ever find a man who
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: could distinguish the one from the other, however carefully he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: looked at it; for the hair was as shining and as golden as the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: gold or even more so. The queen takes the shirt and has given it
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to Alexander. Ah God! how great joy would Alexander have had if
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he had known what the queen is sending him. Very great joy would
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: she too have had, who had sewn her hair there if she had known
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that her love was to have and wear it. Much comfort would she
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have had thereof; for she would not have loved all the rest of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: her hair so much as that which Alexander had. But neither he nor
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: she knew it: great pity is it that they do not know. To the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: harbour where the youths are washing came the messenger of the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: queen; he finds the youths on the beach and has given the shirt
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to him, who is much delighted with it and who held it all the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: dearer for that it came from the queen. But if he had known the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: whole case he would have loved it still more; for he would not
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have taken all the world in exchange, but rather he would have
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: treated it as a relic, I think, and would have worshipped it day
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and night.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Alexander delays no longer to apparel himself straightway. When
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he was clad and equipped he has returned to the tent of the king;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and all his comrades together with him. The queen, as I think,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: had come to sit in the tent because she wished to see the new
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: knights arrive. Well might one esteem them fair; but fairest of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: all was Alexander with the agile body. They are now knights; for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the present I say no more about them. Henceforth shall I speak of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the king and of the host which came to London. The greater part
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of the folk held to his side; but there is a great multitude of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them against him. Count Engres musters his troops, all that he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: can win over to him by promise or by gift. When he had got his
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: men together he has secretly fled by night; for he was hated by
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: several and feared to be betrayed; but before he fled he took
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: from London as much as he could of victuals of gold and of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: silver, and distributed it all to his folk. The tidings is told
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to the king--that the traitor is fled, and all his  army with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him, and that he had taken so much of victuals and goods from the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: city that the burgesses are impoverished and destitute and at a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: loss. And the king has replied just this: that never will he take
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: ransom of the traitor, but will hang him if he can find or take
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him. Now all the host bestirs itself so much that they reached
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Windsor. At that day, however it be now, if any one wished to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: defend the castle, it would not have been easy to take; for the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: traitor enclosed it as soon as he planned the treason with treble
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: walls and moats, and had strengthened the walls behind with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: sharpened stakes, so that they should not be thrown down by any
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: siege-engine. He had spent great sums in strengthening it all
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: June and July and August, in making walls, and bastions, and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: moats, and drawbridges, trenches, and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: breast-works, and barriers, and many a portcullis of iron, and a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: great tower of stones, hewn foursquare. Never had he shut the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: gate there for fear of attack. The castle stands on a high hill
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and below it runs Thames. The host is encamped on the river bank;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: on  that day they had time for nought save encamping and pitching
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their tents.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: The host has encamped on Thames: all the meadow is covered with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: tents, green and vermilion. The sun strikes on the colours and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the river reflects their sheen for more than a full league. The
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: defenders of the castle had come to take their pleasure along the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: strand with their lances only in their hands, their shields
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: locked close in front of them, for they bore no arms but these.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: To their foes without they made it appear that they feared them
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: not at all inasmuch as they had come unarmed. Alexander, on the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: other side, perceived the knights who go before them, playing a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: knightly game on horseback. Hot is his desire to meet with them;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and he calls his comrades one after the other by their names:
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: first Cornix, whom he greatly loved, then the stout Licorides,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: then Nabunal of Mycenae, and Acoriondes of Athens, and Ferolin of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Salonica, and Calcedor from towards Africa, Parmenides and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Francagel, Torin the Strong, and Pinabel, Nerius, and Neriolis.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: "Lords," quoth he, "a longing has seized me to go and make with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lance and with shield acquaintance with those who come to tourney
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: before us. I see full well that they take us for laggards and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: esteem us lightly--so it seems to me--since they have come here
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: all unarmed to tourney before our faces. We have been newly
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: dubbed knights; we have not yet shown our mettle to knights or at
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: quintain. Too long have we kept our new lances virgin. Why were
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: our shields made? Not yet have they been pierced or broken. Such
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: a gift avails us nought save for tour or for assault. Let us pass
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the ford, and let us attack them." All say: "We will not fail
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: you." Each one says: "So may God save me, as I am not the man to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: fail you here." Now they gird on their swords, saddle and girth
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their steeds, mount and take their shields. When they had hung
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the shields from their necks, and taken the lances blazoned in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: quarterings; they all at once rush on to the ford; and the enemy
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lower their lances and ride quickly to strike them. But Alexander
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and his comrades knew well how to pay them back; and they neither
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: spare them nor shirk nor yield a foot before them; rather each
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: strikes his own foe so doughtily that there is no knight so good
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: but he must void his saddle-bow. The Greeks did not take them for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: boys for cowards or for men bewildered. They have not wasted
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their first blows; for they have unhorsed thirteen. The noise of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their blows and strokes has reached as far as to the army. In a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: short time the melee would have been desperate, if the enemy had
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: dared to stand before them. The king's men run through the host
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to take their weapons, and dash into the water noisily, and the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: enemy turn to flight; for they see that it is not good to stay
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: there. And the Greeks follow them, striking with lances and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: swords. Many heads there were cut open; but of the Greeks there
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: was not a single one wounded. They have proved themselves well
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that day. But Alexander won the greatest distinction; for he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: leads away four knights bound to his person and taken prisoners.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: And the dead lie on the strand; for many there lay headless, and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: many wounded and maimed.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Alexander from courtesy gives and presents the first fruits of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his  knighthood to the queen. He does not wish that the king
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: should have possession of the captives; for he would have had
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them all hanged. The queen has had them taken and has had them
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: guarded in prison as accused of treason. Men speak of the Greeks
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: throughout the army; all say that Alexander is right courteous
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and debonair as regards the knights whom he had taken inasmuch as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he had not given them up to the king, who would have had them
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: burned or hanged. But the king is in earnest in the matter.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Forthwith he bids the queen that she come and speak to him and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: keep not her traitors; for it will behove her to give them up or
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he will take them against her will. Then the queen has come to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the king; they have had converse together about the traitors as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: it behoved them; and all the Greeks had been left in the queen's
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: tent with the ladies. Much do the twelve say to them, but
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Alexander does not say a word. Soredamors observed it; she had
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: sat down near him. He has rested his cheek on his hand, and it
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: seems that he is deep in thought. Thus have they sat full long
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: till Soredamors saw on his arm and at his neck the hair with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: which she had made the seam. She has drawn a little nearer him,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: for now she has opportunity of speaking with him; but she
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: considers beforehand how she can be the one to speak, and what
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the first word shall be; whether she will call him by his name;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and she takes counsel of it with herself. "What shall I say
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: first?" thinks she. "Shall I address him by his name, or as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: 'friend'. Friend? Not I. How then? Call him by his name? God! The
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: word friend is so fair and so sweet to say. What if I dared to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: call him friend? Dared? What forbids it me? The fact that I think
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: I should be telling a lie. A lie? I know not what it will be; but
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: if I lie it will be a weight on my mind. For that reason it must
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: be allowed that I should not desire to lie in the matter. God! He
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: would not lie now a whit if he called me his sweet friend. And
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: should I lie in so calling him? Both of us ought indeed to speak
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: truth; but if I lie the wrong will be his. And why is his name so
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: hard to me that I wish to add a name of courtesy? It seems to me
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: there are too many letters in it, and I should become tongue-tied
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: in the middle. But if I called him friend, I should very quickly
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: say this name. But just because I fear to stumble in the other
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: name, I would have given of my heart's-blood if only his name
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: might have been 'my sweet friend'."
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: She delays so long in thus thinking that the queen returns from
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the king, who had sent for her. Alexander sees her coming, and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: goes to meet her, and asks her what the king commands to be done
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: with his prisoners, and what will be their fate. "Friend," says
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: she, "he requires me to yield them up to his discretion and to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: let him do his justice on them. He is very wroth that I have not
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: yet given them up to him and I must send them; for I see no other
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: way out." Thus they have passed this day; and on the morrow the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: good and loyal knights have assembled together before the royal
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: tent to pronounce justice and judgment as to with what penalty
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and with what torture the four traitors should die. Some doom
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that they be flayed, others that they be hanged or burnt, and the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: king himself deems that traitors should be drawn. Then he bids
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them be brought: they are brought; he has them bound, and tells
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them that they shall not be quartered till they are in view of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the castle, so that those within shall see them. When the parley
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: is done, the king addresses Alexander and calls him his dear
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: friend. "Friend," quoth he, "I saw you yesterday make a fair
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: attack and a fair defence. I will give you the due guerdon: I
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: increase your following by 500 Welsh knights and by 1000 footmen
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of this land. When I shall have finished my war, in addition to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: what I have given you, I will have you crowned king of the best
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: realm in Wales. Market-towns and strong castles, cities and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: halls, will I give you, meanwhile, till the land shall be given
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to you which your father holds and of which you must become
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: emperor." Alexander heartily thanks the king for this grant; and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his comrades thank him likewise. All the barons of the Court say
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that the honour which the king designs for him is well vested in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Alexander.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: When Alexander sees his men his comrades and his footmen, such as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the king willed to give him, then they begin to sound horns and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: trumpets throughout the host. Good and bad all, I would have you
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: know, without exception take their arms, those of Wales and of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Brittany of Scotland and of Cornwall; for from all sides without
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: fail strong reinforcements had come in for the host. Thames had
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: shrunk; for there had been no rain all the summer; rather there
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: had been such a drought that the fish in it were dead and the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: ships leaky in the harbour; and one could pass by the ford there
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: where the water was widest of a hair and has delight and joyaunce
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: thereof; but the host has crossed Thames; some beset the valley
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and others mount the height. The defenders of the castle perceive
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: it, and see coming the wondrous host which is preparing outside
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to overthrow and take the castle; and they prepare to defend it.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: But before any attack is made the king has the traitors dragged
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: by four horses round the castle, through the valleys, and over
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: mounds and hillocks. Count Engres is sore grieved when he sees
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: those whom he held dear dragged round his castle; and the others
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: were much dismayed; but for all the dismay that they feel thereat
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they have no desire to surrender. Needs must they defend
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: themselves; for the king displays openly to all his displeasure
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and his wrath; and full well they see that if he held them he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: would make them die shamefully.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: When the four had been drawn and their limbs lay o'er the field,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: then the attack begins; but all their toil is vain; for howsoever
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they may hurl and throw their missiles, they can avail nought.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: And yet they try hard; they throw and hurl a thick cloud of bolts
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and javelins and darts. The catapults and slings make a great din
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: on all sides; arrows and round stone fly likewise in confusion as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: thick as rain mingled with hail. Thus they toil all day: these
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: defend, and those attack until night separates them, one from the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: other, nor need they trouble to flee, nor do they see. And the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: king on his part has it cried through the host and made known
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: what gift that man will have of him by whom the castle shall have
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: been taken: a goblet of very great price, worth fifteen golden
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: marks, the richest in his treasure, will he give him. The goblet
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: will be very fair and rich; and he whose judgement goes not
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: astray ought to hold it dearer for the workmanship than for the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: material. The goblet is very precious in workmanship, and if I
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: were to disclose the whole truth, the jewels on the outside were
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: worth more than the workmanship or the gold. If he by whom the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: castle will be taken is but a foot soldier, he shall have the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: cup. And if it is taken by a knight, never shall he seek any
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: reward besides the cup; but he will have it if it can be found in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the world. When this matter was proclaimed Alexander, who went
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: each evening to see the queen, had not forgotten his custom. On
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: this evening he had again gone thither; they were seated side by
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: side, both Alexander and the queen. Before them Soredamors was
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: sitting alone nearest to them; and she looked at him as gladly as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: though she would not have preferred to be in Paradise. The queen
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: held Alexander by his right hand, and looked at the golden thread
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: which had become greatly tarnished; and the hair was becoming yet
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: fairer whereas the gold thread was growing pale; and she
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: remembered by chance that Soredamors had done the stitching and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: she laughed thereat. Alexander observed it and asks her, if it
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: may be told, to tell him what makes her laugh. The queen delays
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to tell him, and looks towards Soredamors, and has called her
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: before her. She has come very gladly and kneels before her.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Alexander was much joyed when he saw her approach so near that he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: could have touched her; but he has not so much courage as to dare
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: even to look at her; but all his senses have so left him that he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: has almost become dumb. And she, on the other hand, is so
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: bewildered that she has no use of her eyes, but fixes her gaze on
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the ground, and dares not direct it elsewhere. The queen greatly
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: marvels; she sees her now pale, now flushed, and notes well in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: her heart the bearing and appearance of each and of the two
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: together. She sees clearly and truly, it seems to her, judging by
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the changes of colour, that these are signs of love; but she does
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: not wish to cause them anguish: she feigns to know nothing of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: what she sees. She did just what it behoved her to do; for she
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: gave no look or hint save that she said to the maiden: "Damsel,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: look yonder and tell--hide it not from us--where the shirt that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: this knight has donned was sewn, and whether you had a hand in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: it, and put in it somewhat of yours?" The maiden is ashamed to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: say it; nevertheless, she tells it to him gladly; for she wishes
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that he should hear the truth; and he has such joy of hearing it
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: when she tells and describes to him the making of the shirt, that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: with great difficulty he restrains himself when he sees the hair
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: from worshipping and doing reverence to it. His comrades and the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: queen, who were there with him, cause him great distress and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: annoyance; for on account of them he refrains from raising it to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his eyes and to his lips where he would fain have pressed it if
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he had not thought that they would see him. He is blithe that he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: has so much of his lady-love; but he does not think or expect to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have ever any other boon of her. His desire makes him fear;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: nevertheless, when he is alone he kisses it more than a hundred
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: thousand times when he has left the queen. Now it seems to him
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that he was born in a lucky hour. Very great joy does he have of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: it all night, but he takes good care that no one sees him. When
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he has lain down in his bed, he delights and consoles him self
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: fruitlessly with that in which there is no delight; all night he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: embraces the shirt, and when he beholds the hair he thinks he is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lord of all the world. Truly Love makes a wise man a fool: since
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he has joy, he will change his pastime before the bright dawn and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the sunlight. The traitors are holding counsel as to what they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: will be able to do and what will become of them. Long time they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: will be able to defend the castle; that is a certainty if they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: apply themselves to the defence; but they know that the king is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of so fierce a courage that in all his life he will never turn
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: away until he has taken it; then they must needs die. And if they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: surrender the castle they expect no grace for that. Thus the one
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lot or the other; it has fallen out ill for them; for they have
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: no reinforcement, and they see death on all sides. But the end of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their deliberation is that to-morrow, before day appears, they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: resolve to issue forth secretly from the castle, and to fall on
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the host unarmed, and the knights asleep, since they will still
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: be lying in their beds. Before these have awakened, apparelled
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and equipped, themselves, they will have made such slaughter that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: ever hereafter shall be related the battle of that night. To this
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: plan all the traitors cling from desperation, for they have no
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: confidence as to their lives. Lack of hope as to the outcome
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: emboldens them to the battle, for they see no issue for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: themselves except through death or prison. Such an issue is no
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: wholesome one, nor need they trouble to flee, nor do they see
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: where they could find refuge if they should have fled; for the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: sea and their enemies are around them, and they in the midst. No
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: longer do they tarry at their council: now they apparel and arm
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: themselves, and issue forth towards the north-west by an ancient
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: postern towards that side whence they thought that those of the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: host would least expect to see them come. In serried ranks they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: sallied forth: of their men they made five battalions; and there
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: were no less than two thousand foot-soldiers well equipped for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: battle and a thousand knights in each. This night neither star
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: nor moon had shown its rays in the sky; but before they had
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: reached the tents the moon began to rise, and, I believe that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: just to vex them, it rose earlier than it was wont; and God who
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: wished to injure them lit up the dark night, for He had no care
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of their army; rather He hated them for their sin with which they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: were tainted for traitors and treason which God hates more than
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: any other crime; so the moon began to shine because it was doomed
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to injure them.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: The moon was veritably hostile to them; for it shone on their
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: glittering shields; and the helmets likewise greatly embarrass
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them, for they reflect the light of the moon for the sentries who
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: were set to guard the host see them; and they cry throughout all
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the host: "Up, knights! Up, rise quickly! Take your arms, arm
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: yourselves! Behold the traitors upon us!" Through all the host
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they spring to arms; they rouse themselves and don with haste
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their harness, as men must do in case of stress. Never did a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: single one of them stir forth till they were fully equipped; and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: all mounted on their steeds. While they are arming, the enemy, on
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the other hand, who greatly desire the battle, are bestirring
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: themselves, so that they may take them unawares and likewise find
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them unarmed; and they send forth their men whom they had divided
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: into five bands. Some kept beside the wood; others came along the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: river; the third placed themselves in the plain; and the fourth
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: were in a valley; and the fifth battalion spurs along the moat
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that surrounded a rock, for they thought to swoop down
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: impetuously among the tents. But they have not found a road that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they could follow, or a way that was not barred; for the king's
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: men block their way as they very proudly defy them and reproach
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them with treason. They engage with the iron heads of their
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lances, so that they splinter and break them; they come to close
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: quarters with swords; and champion strikes champion to the ground
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and makes him bite the dust; each side strikes down its foes, and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: as fiercely as lions devouring whatsoever they can seize rush on
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their prey; so fiercely do they rush on their foe--aye, and more
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: fiercely. On both sides, of a truth, there was very great loss of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: life at that first attack; but reinforcements come for the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: traitors, who defend themselves very fiercely, and sell their
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lives dear when they can keep them no longer. On four sides they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: see their battalions coming to succour them; and the king's men
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: gallop upon them as fast as they can spur. They rush to deal them
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: such blows on the shields, that together with the wounded they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have overthrown more than five hundred of them. The Greeks spare
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them not at all. Alexander is not idle, for he exerts himself to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: act bravely. In the thickest of the fray he rushes so impetuously
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to smite a traitor, that neither shield nor hauberk availed one
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: whit to save that traitor from being thrown to the ground. When
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Alexander has made a truce with him forsooth, he pays his
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: attentions to another--attentions in which he does not waste or
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lose his pains. He serves him in such valiant sort that he rends
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his soul from his body; and the house remains without a tenant.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: After these two Alexander picks a quarrel with a third: he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: strikes a right noble court knight through both flanks in such
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: wise that the blood gushes out of the wound on the opposite side;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and the soul takes leave of the body, for the foe man has
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: breathed it forth. Many a one he kills; many a one he maims; for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: like the forked lightning he attacks all those that he seeks out.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Him whom he strikes with lance or sword, neither corselet nor
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: shield protects. His comrades also are very lavish in spilling
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: blood and brains; well do they know how to deal their blows. And
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the king's men cut down so many that they break and scatter them
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: like common folk distraught. So many dead lie o'er the fields and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: so long has the scour lasted, that the battle-array was broken up
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: a long while before it was day; and the line of dead down along
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the river extended five leagues. Count Engres leaves his standard
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: in the battle and steals away; and he has taken seven of his
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: companions together with him. He has returned towards his castle
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: by so hidden a way that he thinks that no one sees; but Alexander
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: marks him; for he sees them flee from the host, and thinks to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: steal away and meet them, so that no one will know where he has
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: gone. But before he was in the valley he saw as many as thirty
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: knights coming after him along a path, six of whom were Greeks,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and the other four-and-twenty Welsh; for they thought that they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: would follow him at a distance until it should come to the pinch.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: When Alexander perceived them he stopped to wait, and marks which
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: way those who are returning to the castle take until he sees them
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: enter. Then he begins to meditate on a very hazardous venture and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: on a very wondrous stratagem. And when he had finished all his
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: thinking, he turns towards his comrades, and thus has related and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: said to them: "Lords," quoth he, "without gainsaying me, if ye
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: wish to have my love, whether it be prompted by folly or wisdom,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: grant me my wish." And they have granted it; for never will they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: refuse him anything that he may choose to do. "Let us change our
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: insignia," quoth he; "let us take shields and lances from the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: traitors that we have slain. Thus we shall go towards the castle,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and the traitors within will think that we are of their party,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and whatever the requital may be the doors will be opened to us.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Know ye in what wise we shall requite them? We shall take them
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: all or dead or living if God grant it us; and  if any of you
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: repent you know that as long as I live, I shall never love him
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: with a good heart."
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: All grant him his will: they go and seize the shields from the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Dead; and they arrive with this equipment. And the folk of the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: castle had mounted to the battlements of the tower, for they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: recognised the shields full well and think that they belong to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their own men; for they were unsuspicious of the ambush which
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lurks beneath the shields. The porter opens the door to them and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: has received them within. He is so beguiled and deceived that he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: does not address them at all; and not one of them breathes a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: word, but they pass on mute and silent, feigning such grief that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they drag their lances behind them and bend beneath their
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: shields, so that it seems that they are sorrowing greatly; and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they go in whatever direction they wish until they have passed
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the three walls. Up yonder they find so many foot-soldiers and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: knights with the count, I cannot tell you the number of them; but
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they were all unarmed except the eight alone, who had returned
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: from the army; and these even were preparing to take off their
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: armour. But they might well prove over-hasty; for those who have
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: come upon them up yonder no longer hid themselves, but put their
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: steeds to the gallop. All press on their stirrups and fall upon
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them and attack them, so that they strike dead thirty-and-one
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: before they have given the challenge. The traitors are much
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: dismayed thereat and cry, "Betrayed! Betrayed!" But Alexander and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his friends are not confused; for as soon as they find them all
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: unarmed they test their swords well there. Even three of those
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: whom they found armed have they so served that they have only
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: left five. Count Engres has rushed forward, and before the eyes
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of all goes to strike Calcedor on his golden shield, so that he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: throws him to the ground dead. Alexander is much grieved when he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: sees his comrade slain; he well-nigh goes mad with the fury that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: comes upon him. His reason is dimmed with anger, but his strength
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and courage are doubled, and he goes to strike the count with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: such a mighty force that his lance breaks; for willingly, if he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: could, would he avenge the death of his friend. But the count was
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of great strength, a good and bold knight to boot, such that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: there would not have been a better in the world if he had not
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: been disloyal and a traitor. The count, on his side, prepares to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: give him such a blow that he bends his lance, so that it
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: altogether splinters and breaks; but the shield does not break
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and the one knight does not shake the other from his seat any
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: more than he would have shaken a rock, for both were very strong.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: But the fact that the count was in the wrong mightily vexes and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: weakens him. The one grows furious against the other, and both
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have drawn their swords, since they had broken their lances. And
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: there would have been no escape if these two champions had wished
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: further to prolong the fight; one or the other would have had to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: die forthwith at the end. But the count does not dare to stand
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his ground, for he sees his men slain around him, who, being
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: unarmed, were taken unawares. And the king's men pursue them
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: fiercely, and hack and hew, and cleave, and brain them, and call
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the count a traitor. When he hears himself accused of treason, he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: flees for refuge towards his keep; and his men flee with him. And
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their enemies who fiercely rush after take them captive; they let
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: not a single one escape of all those that they catch. They kill
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and slay so many that I do not think that more than seven reached
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: a place of safety. When the traitors entered the keep, they are
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: stayed at the entrance; for their pursuers had followed them so
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: close that their men would have got in if the entrance had been
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: open. The traitors defend themselves well; for they expect
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: succour from them who were arming in the town below. But by the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: advice of Nabunal, a Greek who was very wise, the way was held
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: against the reinforcements, so that they could not come in time,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: for they had tarried over-long from lukewarmness and indolence.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Up there into that fortress there was only one single entry; if
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the Greeks stop up that entrance, they will have no need to fear
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the coming of any force from which ill may befall them. Nabunal
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: bids and exhorts that twenty of them go to defend the outer
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: gateway; for easily there might they press in that way to attack
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and overwhelm them--foemen who would do them harm if they had
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: strength and power to do so. "Let a score of men go to defend the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: gateway, and let the other ten assail the keep from without, so
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that the count may not shut himself up inside." This is what
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Nabunal advises: the ten remain in the melee before the entrance
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of the keep; the score go to the gate. They have delayed almost
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: too long; for they see coming a company, flushed and heated with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: desire of fighting, in which there were many crossbow-men and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: foot-soldiers of divers equipment, bearing diverse arms. Some
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: carried light missiles, and others, Danish axes, Turkish lances
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and swords, arrows and darts and javelins. Very heavy would have
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: been the reckoning that the Greeks would have had to pay,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: peradventure, if this company had come upon them, but they did
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: not come in time. By the wisdom and by the prudence of Nabunal,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they forestalled them and kept them without. When the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: reinforcements see that they are shut out, then they remain idle,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: for they see well that by attacking they will be able to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: accomplish nought in the matter. Then there rises a mourning and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: a cry of women and of little children, of old men and of youths,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: so great that if it had thundered from the sky those within the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: castle would not have heard aught of it. The Greeks greatly
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: rejoice thereat; for now they all know of a surety that never by
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: any chance will the count escape being taken. They bid four of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them mount in haste to the battlements of the wall to see that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: those without do not from any quarter, by any stratagem or trick,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: press into the castle to attack them. The sixteen have returned
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to the ten who are fighting. Now was it bright daylight, and now
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the ten had forced their way into the keep, and the count, armed
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: with an axe, had taken his stand beside a pillar where he defends
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: himself right fiercely. He cleaves asunder all who come within
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his reach. And his followers range themselves near him; in their
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: last day's work they take such good vengeance that they spare not
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their strength at all. Alexander's knights lament that there were
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: no more than thirteen of them left though even now there were
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: twenty-and-six. Alexander well-neigh raves with fury when he sees
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: such havoc among his men who are thus killed and wounded, but he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: is not slow to revenge. He has found at hand, by his side, a long
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and heavy beam, and goes to strike therewith a traitor; and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: neither the foeman's shield nor hauberk availed him a whit
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: against being borne to the ground. After him, he attacks the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: count; in order to strike well he raises the beam; and he deals
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him such a blow with his square-hewn beam that the axe falls from
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his hands; and he was so stunned and so weak, that if he had not
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: leaned against the wall his feet would not have supported him.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: With this blow the battle ceases. Alexander leaps towards the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: count and seizes him in such wise that he cannot move. No need is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: there to tell more of the others, for easily were they vanquished
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: when they saw their lord taken. They capture them all with the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: count and lead them away in dire shame even as they had deserved.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Of all this, King Arthur's host who were without, knew not a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: word; but in the morning when the battle was ended they had found
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their shields among the bodies; and the Greeks were raising a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: very loud lamentation for their lord but wrongly. On account of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his shield which they recognise they one and all make great
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: mourning, and swoon over his shield, and say that they have lived
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: too long. Cornix and Nerius swoon; and when they come to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: themselves they blame their lives for being yet whole in them.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: And so do Torins and Acoriondes; the tears ran in streams from
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their eyes right on to their breasts. Life and joy are but
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: vexation to them. And above all Parmenides has dishevelled and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: torn his hair. These five make so great a mourning for their lord
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that greater there cannot be. But they disquiet themselves in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: vain; instead of him, they are bearing away another; and yet they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: think that they are bearing away their lord. The other shields
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: too cause them much sorrow by reason whereof they think that the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: bodies are those of their comrades; and they swoon and lament
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: over them. But the shields lie one and all; for of their men
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: there was but one slain who was named, Neriolis. Him truly would
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they have borne away had they known the truth. But they are in as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: great distress about the others as about him; and they have borne
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and taken them all. About all but one they are mistaken; but even
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: like a man who dreams, who believes a lie instead of truth, the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: shields made them believe that this lie was true. They are
title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: There is none who does not manifest joy. The mourning that they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: were formerly making yields to joy; but no joy can be compared
title: Cliges: A Romance

text: with that of the Greeks. The king bids them give him the cup

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: which was very magnificent and worth fifteen marks; and he tells
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: knows well that the king would not disappoint him if he asked for

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: who would have had great joy thereat; for rather does he wish
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: grief for himself without her than to have her without her will.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Therefore he begs and requests a respite; for he does not wish to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: make his request till he know her pleasure in the matter; but he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: has sought neither respite nor delay in possessing himself of the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: great reluctance has that knight accepted it. When Soredamors has
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: heard the true news about Alexander much did it please and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: wont. Soon she will have what she desires;  for the two vie with
title: Cliges: A Romance
