text: dies, she will die. Never will any hope of consolation avail to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: deter her from dying with him; for without him life has no charm
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: for her.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: When all had come into the field, high and low, young and hoary,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and the guards bad been set there, then have both champions taken
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: their lances; and they meet in no half-hearted way, so that each
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: breaks his lance, and both are unhorsed and fail to keep their
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: saddles. But quickly have they risen to their feet, for they were
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: not at all wounded, and again they encounter without delay. They
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: play a merry tune with their swords on the resounding helms, so
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that their retinue are amazed; and it seems to those who watch
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them that the helmets are on fire and ablaze. And when the swords
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: rebound, glowing sparks jet forth as from red-hot iron which the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: smith hammers on the anvil when he draws it from the furnace.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Very lavish are both the warriors in dealing blows in great
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Store; and each has a good will to pay back quickly what he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: borrows; neither the one nor the other ceases from paying back
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: capital and interest immediately, all without count and without
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: stint. But the duke comes on in great anger, and right wroth and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: furious is he because he has not quelled and slain Cliges at the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: first encounter. He deals him a great blow, marvellous and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: strong, such that at his feet Cliges has fallen on one knee.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: At the blow whereby Cliges fell was the emperor much amazed; he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: was no whit less bewildered than if he had been behind the shield
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: himself. Then Fenice, so much was she amazed, can no longer
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: restrain herself, whatever might come of it, from crying: "God!
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Aid!" as loud as ever she could. But she had called out but one
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: word when, forthwith, her voice failed, and she fell swooning,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and with arms outstretched so that her face was a little wounded.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Two noble barons raised her, and have held her on her feet till
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: she has returned to her senses. But never did any who saw her,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: whatever appearance she presented, know why she swooned. Never
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: did any man blame her for it; rather they have all praised her;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: for there is not a single one who does not believe that she would
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have done the same for his sake if he had been in Cliges' place;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: but in all this there is no truth. Cliges, when Fenice cried,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: heard and marked her right well. The sound restored to him
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: strength and courage, and be springs swiftly to his feet, and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: advanced furiously to meet the duke, and thrusts at him, and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: presses him so that the duke was amazed thereat; for he finds him
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: more greedy for combat, more strong and agile than he had found
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him before, it seems to him, when they first encountered. And
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: because he fears his onset he says to him: "Knight, so may God
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: save me, I see thee right courageous and valiant. But if it had
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: not been for my nephew, whom I shall never forget, willingly
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: would I have made peace with thee, and would have released thee
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: from the quarrel; for never would I have meddled any more in the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: matter." "Duke," says Cliges, "what may be your pleasure? Is it
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: not meet that he who cannot make good his claim yield it, one of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: two evils; when one has to choose, one ought to choose the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lesser. When your nephew picked a quarrel with me, he acted
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: unwisely. I will serve you in the same way--be assured of it--if
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: I ever can, if I do not receive submission from you." The duke,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to whom it seems that Cliges was growing in strength every
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: moment, thinks that it is much better for him to stop short
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: half-way before he is altogether wearied out. Nevertheless, he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: does not confess to him the truth quite openly, but he says:
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: "Knight, I see thee debonair and agile and of great courage. But
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: exceeding young art thou: for this reason I reflect, and I know
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of a surety, that if I conquer and kill thee, never should I win
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: praise or esteem thereby, nor should I ever see any man of valour
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: in whose hearing I should dare to confess that I had fought with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: thee, for I should do honour to thee and shame to myself. But if
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: those knowst what honour means, a great honour will it be to thee
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: for ever that thou hast stood thy ground against me, even for two
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: encounters only. Now a wish and desire has come to me, to release
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: thee from the quarrel and not to fight with thee any longer."
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: "Duke," quoth Cliges, "you talk idly. You shall say it aloud in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the hearing of all, and never shall it be told or related that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: you have done me a kindness, or that you have had mercy on me. In
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the hearing of one and all of these who are here, you will have
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to declare it if you wish to make peace with me." The duke
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: declares it in the hearing of all. Thus have they made peace and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: agreement; but whatever the issue of the matter, Cliges had the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: honour and the renown of it; and the Greeks had very great joy
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: thereof. But the Saxons could not make light of the matter; for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: well had they all seen their lord exhausted and worsted; nor is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: there any question but that, if he had been able to do better for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: himself, this peace would never have been made; rather would he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have rent the soul out of Cliges' body if he had been able to do
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: it.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: The duke returns to Saxony, grieved and downcast and Ashamed; for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of his men--there are not two who do not hold him a conquered
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: man, a craven, and a coward. The Saxons, with all their shame,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have returned to Saxony. And the Greeks delay no longer; they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: return towards Constantinople with great joy and with great
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: gladness; for well by his prowess has Cliges assured to them the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: way. Now the emperor of Germany no further follows or attends
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them. After taking leave of the Greek folk and of his daughter
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and of Cliges and of the emperor, he has remained in Germany; and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the emperor of the Greeks goes away right glad and right joyful.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Cliges, the valiant, the well-bred, thinks of his father's
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: command. If his uncle the emperor will grant him leave, he will
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: go to request and pray him to let him go to Britain to speak to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his uncle the king; for he craves to know and see him. He sets
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: out for the presence of the emperor, and begs him if it please
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him to let him go to Britain to see his uncle and his friends.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Very gently has he made this request; but his uncle refuses it to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him when he has heard and listened to the whole of his request
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and his story. "Fair nephew," quoth he, "it pleases me not that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: you should wish to leave me. Never will I give you this leave or
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: this permission without great grief; for right pleasant and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: convenient is it that you should be my partner and co-ruler with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: me of all my empire."
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Now there is nothing which pleases Cliges, since his uncle denies
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him what he asks and requests; and he says: "Fair Sire, it
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: becomes me not, nor am I brave or wise enough to be given this
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: partnership with you or with another so as to rule an empire;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: very young am I and know but little. For this reason is gold
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: applied to the touchstone because one wishes to know if it is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: real gold. So wish I--that is the end and sum of it--to assay and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: prove myself where I think to find the touchstone. In Britain if
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: I am valiant I shall be able to put myself to the touch with the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Whetstone; and with the true and genuine assay by which I shall
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: test my prowess. In Britain are those valiant men of whom honour
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and prowess boast. And he who wishes to gain honour, ought to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: join himself to their company; for there the honour resides and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: is won which appertains to the man of valour. Therefore, I ask
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: you this leave; and know of a surety that if you do not send me
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: thither and do not grant me the boon, then I shall go without
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: your leave." "Fair nephew, rather do I give it you freely when I
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: see you thus minded; for I would not have the heart to detain you
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: by force or by prayer. Now may God give you heart and will to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: return soon since neither prayer nor prohibition nor force could
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: prevail in the matter. I would have you take with you a talent of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: gold and of silver, and horses to delight you will I give you,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: all at your choice." No sooner had he said his word than Cliges
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: has bowed to him. All whatsoever the emperor has devised and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: promised was at once set before him. Cliges took as much wealth
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and as many comrades as pleased and behoved him; but for his own
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: private use he takes away four different steeds: one white, one
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: sorrel, one dun, one black. But I was about to pass over one

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: thing that must not be omitted. Cliges goes to take leave of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: would fain commend her to God. He comes before her and kneels
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: down, weeping, so that he moistens with his tears all his tunic

text: not look straight in front of him, just as if he has committed
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: some wrong and crime towards her, and now shows by his mien that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he has shame for it. And Fenice, who beholds him timidly and

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: shyly, knows not what matter brings him; and she has said to him
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: in some distress: "Friend, fair sir, rise; sit by my side; weep
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: no more and tell me your pleasure." "Lady! What shall I say? What
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: conceal? I seek your permission to depart." "Depart? Why?"
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: "Lady! I must go away to Britain." "Tell me, then, on what quest,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: before I give you permission." "Lady, my father, when he died and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: departed this life, prayed me on no account to fail to go to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Britain as soon as I should be a knight. For nothing in the world
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: would I neglect his command. It will behove me not to play the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: laggard as I go thither. It is a very long journey from here to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Greece; and if I were to go thither the journey from
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Constantinople to Britain would be very long for me. But it is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: meet that I take leave of you as being the lady whose I am
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: wholly." Many hidden and secret sighs and sobs had he made on

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

title: Cliges: A Romance

text: such and such counts, and such and such others. When the barons

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: were to meet, a knight of great prowess of King Arthur's peers
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: rode out all alone between the two ranks to begin the tourney, as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: was the custom at that time. But none dares ride forward to come
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and joust against him. There is none who does not stay where he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: is; and yet there are some who ask: "Why do these knights wait?
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Why does none ride forth from the ranks? Surely someone will
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: straightway begin." And on the other side they say: "See ye not
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: what a champion our adversaries have sent us from their side? Let
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him who has not yet known it know that, of the four bravest
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: known, this is a pillar equal to the rest." "Who is he, then?"
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: "See ye him not? It is Sagremors the Lawless." "Is it he?"
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: "Truly, without doubt." Cliges, who hears and hearkens to this,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: sat on Morel, and had armour blacker than a ripe mulberry: his
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: whole armour was black. He separates himself from the others in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the rank and spurs Morel who comes out of the row; not one is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: there who sees him but says to his neighbour: "This man rides
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: well with feutred lance; here have we a very skilful knight; he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: bears his arms in the right fashion; well does the shield at his
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: neck become him. But one cannot but hold him mad as regards the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: joust he has undertaken of his own accord against one of the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: bravest known in all this land. But who is he? Of what land is he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: a native? Who knows him?" "Not I!" "Nor I!" "But no snow has
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: fallen on him! Rather is his armour blacker than monk's or
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: priest's cape." Thus they engage in gossip; and the two champions
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: let their horses go; for no longer do they delay because right
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: eager and aflame are they for the encounter and the shock. Cliges
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: strikes so that he presses Sagremors' shield to his arm, and his
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: arm to his body. Sagremors falls at full length; Cliges acts
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: irreproachably, and makes him declare himself prisoner: Sagremors
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: gives his parole. Now the fight begins, and they charge in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: rivalry. Cliges has rushed to the combat, and goes seeking joust
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and encounter. He encounters no knight whom he does not take or
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lay low. On both sides he wins the highest distinction; for where
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he rides to joust, he brings the whole tourney to a standstill.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Yet he who gallops up to joust with him is not without great
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: prowess; but he wins more renown for standing his ground against
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Cliges than for taking prisoner another knight; and if Cliges
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: leads him away captive, yet he enjoys great distinction for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: merely daring to withstand him in the joust. Cliges has the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: praise and distinction of the whole tournament. And even secretly
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he has returned to his lodging so that none of them might accost
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him about one thing or another. And in case any one should have
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: search made for the lodging marked by the black arms, he locks
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them up in a room so that they may neither be found nor seen; and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he has the green arms openly displayed at the door, fronting the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: road so that the passers by shall see them. And if any asks for
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him and seeks him, he will not know where his lodging will be,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: since he will see no sign of the black shield that he seeks. Thus
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Cliges is in the town and hides himself by such a device. And
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: those who were his prisoners went from end to end of the town
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: asking for the black knight; but none could tell them where he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: was. And even King Arthur sends up and down to seek him; but all
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: say: "We did not see him after we left the tourney and know not
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: what became of him." More than twenty youths whom the king has
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: sent seek him; but Cliges has so utterly blotted out his tracks
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that they find no sign of him. King Arthur crosses himself when
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: it was recounted and told him, that neither great nor small is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: found who can point out his dwelling any more than if he were at
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Qesarea, or at Toledo, or in Candia. "Faith!" quoth he, "I know
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: not what to say in the matter, but I marvel greatly thereat. It
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: was perhaps a ghost that has moved among us. Many a knight has he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: overthrown today; and he bears away the parole of the noblest men
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: who will not this year see home or land or country; and each of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: whom will have broken his oath." Thus the king spake his pleasure
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: though he might very well have kept silence in the matter.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Much have all the barons spoken that night of the black knight,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: for they spoke of nought else. On the morrow they returned to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: arms, all without summons and without entreaty. Lancelot of the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Lake has dashed forth to make the first joust; for no coward is
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he; with upright lance he awaits the joust. Lo! Cliges, greener
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: than meadow grass, galloping on a dun, long-maned steed. Where
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Cliges pricks on the tawny steed, there is none, whether decked
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: with youth's luxuriant locks or bald, who does not behold him
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: with wonder; and they say on both sides: "This man is in all
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: respects much nobler and more skilful than he of yesterday with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the black arms, just as the pine is fairer than the beech, and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the laurel than the elder. But not yet have we learned who he of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: yesterday was; but we will learn this very day who this one is.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: If anyone know it, let him tell us." Each said: "I know him not,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: never did I see him before to my thinking. But he is fairer than
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the knight of yesterday and fairer than Lancelot of the Lake. If
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he were arrayed in a sack and Lancelot in silver and gold, yet
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: this man would still be fairer." Thus all side with Cliges; and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the two prick their steeds as fast as they can spur and encounter
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: one another. Cliges proceeds to deal such a blow on the golden
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: shield with the painted lion, that he hurls its bearer from the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: saddle and fell on him in order to receive his submission.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Lancelot could not defend himself and has given his parole. Then
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the noise and the din and the crash of lances has begun. Those
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: who were on Cliges' side have all their trust in him; for he whom
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he strikes after due challenge given will never be so strong but
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that he must needs fall from his horse to the ground. Cliges,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: this day, wrought so bravely, and threw down and captured so
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: many, that he has pleased those on his side twice as much, and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: has had twice as much praise from them as he had the day before.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: When evening has come he has repaired to his lodging as quickly
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: as he could; and speedily bids the red shield and the other
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: armour be brought forth. He orders that the arms which he bore
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that day be stowed away; the landlord has carefully done it. Long
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have the knights whom he had captured sought him that night
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Again; but no news do they hear of him. The greater part of those
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: who speak of him at the inns laud and praise him.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Next day the knights return to arms, alert and strong. From the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: array before Oxford rides out a knight of great renown; Percival
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the Welshman, was he called. As soon as Cliges saw him ride forth
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and heard the truth as to his name--for he heard him called
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Percival--he greatly longs to encounter him. Forthwith has he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: ridden forth from the rank on a sorrel, Spanish steed; and his
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: armour was red. Then they, one and all, regard him with great
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: wonder, more than they ever did before and say that never before
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: did they see so comely a knight. And the two prick forward at
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: once; for there was no delay. And the one and the other spurs on
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: so that they give and take mighty blows on their shields. The
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lances, which were short and thick, bend and curve. In the sight
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: of all who were looking on, Cliges has struck Percival, so that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he smites him down from his horse, and makes him give parole
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: without much fighting, and without great ado. When Percival had
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: submitted, then they have begun the tourney; and they all
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: encounter together. Cliges encounters no knight but he fells him
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to the ground. On this day one could not see him a single hour
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: absent from the fight. Each for himself strikes a blow at Cliges

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: as though at a tower: not merely two or three strike, for then

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that was not the use or custom. Cliges has made an anvil of his
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: shield; for all play the smith and hammer upon it and cleave and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and throws him from his stirrups and saddle; and no one, except a

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: man who wished to lie, could have said on his departure that the

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: best and most courteous would fain have his acquaintances, but
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: that cannot be so soon; for he has gone away, secretly, when he

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: saw that the sun had set; and he has had his red shield and all
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his other armour taken away; and he has the white arms brought in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: which he had been newly knighted; and the arms and the steed were

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: placed in front of the door. But now they begin to perceive (for

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the greater part who speak of it say so, and perceive it to be
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: so), that they have all been discomfited, and put to flight by a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: single man, who each day changes his outward show, both horse and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: armour, and seems another than himself; they have now for the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: first time perceived it. And my lord Gawain has said that never
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: before did he see such a jouster; and because he would fain have
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his acquaintance and know his name, he says that he will be first

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: tomorrow at the encounter of the knights. But he makes no boast;
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: master; for never could Gawain find his master. Now will he prove

text: than that of a stag who hears the baying of dogs barking after

title: Cliges: A Romance

text: it thine." "Mine, sire? Truly, as his serf I am not even my own,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: nor have I anything that is mine, save in so far as he grants it
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to me. And if you would say that my lord has done you wrong, I am
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: ready to defend him from the charge without his bidding me so to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: do. But the knowledge that I must die makes me bold to speak out
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: freely my will and my mind as I have fashioned and moulded it.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Now, be that as it may be, for if I die for my lord, I shall not
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: die in dishonour. Surely without a doubt is known the oath and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: promise that you pledged to your brother, that after you, Cliges,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: who is going away into exile, should be emperor. And if it please
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: God, he will yet be emperor. And you are to be blamed for this,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: for you ought not to have taken wife, but all the same you took
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: one and wronged Cliges, and he has wronged you in nought. And if
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: I am done to death by you and die for him unjustly, if he lives,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: he will avenge my death. Now do your utmost, for if I die, you
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: will die too."
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Beads of wrath break out on the emperor's brow when he has heard
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the words and the insult that John has uttered against him.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: "John," quoth he, "thou shalt have respite until what time thy
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lord be found, for base has he proved himself towards me, who
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: held him right dear, nor thought to defraud him. But thou shalt
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: be kept fast in prison. If thou knowest what has become of him,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: tell me straightway, I bid thee." "Tell you? And how should I
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: commit so great a treason? Of a surety, I would not betray to you
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: my lord, not though you were to rend my life out of my body, if I
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: knew it. And besides this, so may God be my guard, I cannot say
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: any more than you in what direction they have gone. But you are
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: jealous without a cause. Too little do I fear your wrath not to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: tell you truly in the hearing of all how you are deceived, and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: yet I shall never be believed in this matter. By a potion that
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: you drank, you were tricked and deceived the night that you
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: celebrated your wedding. Never at any time, save when you slept
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and it happened to you in your dreams, did any joy come to you of
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: her; but the night made you dream, and the dream pleased you as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: much as if it had happened in your waking hours that she held you
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: in her arms; and no other boon came to you from her. Her heart
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: clave so straitly to Cliges that for his sake she pretended to be
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: dead; and he trusted me so much that he told me and placed her in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: my house, of which he is lord by right. You ought not to lay the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: blame on me for it; I should have merited to be burnt or hanged,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: if I had betrayed my lord and refused to do his will."
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: When the emperor heard tell of the potion which it delighted him
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: to drink, and by which Thessala deceived him, then first he
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: perceived that he had never had joy of his wife--well he knew
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: it--unless it had happened to him in a dream, and that such joy
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: was illusory. He says that, if he take not vengeance for the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: shame and the disgrace brought on him by the traitor who has
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: carried off from him his wife, never again will he have joy in
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his life. "Now, quick!" quoth he, "to Pavia, and from there to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Germany, let neither castle, town, nor city be left where he be
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: not sought. He who shall bring them both prisoners will be more
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: cherished by me than any other man. Now, set well to work and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: search both up and down and near and far!" Then they start with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: great zeal, and they have spent all the day in searching; but
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Cliges had such friends among them that, if they found the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lovers, they rather would lead them to a place of refuge than
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: bring them back. Throughout a whole fortnight with no small pains
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they have pursued them, but Thessala, who is guiding them, leads
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: them so safely by art and by enchantment that they have no fear
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: or alarm for all the forces of the emperor. In no town or city do
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: they lie, and yet they have whatsoever they wish and desire, as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: good as or better than they are wont to have, for Thessala seeks
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: and procures and brings for them whatsoever they wish, and no one
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: follows or pursues them, for all have abandoned the quest. But
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Cliges does not delay; he goes to his uncle, King Arthur. He
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: sought him till he found him, and has made to him a complaint and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: an outcry against his uncle the emperor, who, in order to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: disinherit him, had taken wife dishonourably, when he should not
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: have done so, seeing that he had pledged his word to Cliges'
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: father that never in his life would he have a wife. And the king
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: says that with a navy will he sail to Constantinople, and fill a
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: thousand ships with knights and three thousand with infantry,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: such that nor city nor borough nor town nor castle, however
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: strong or high it be, will be able to endure their onset. And
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Cliges has not forgotten to thank the king then and there for the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: aid which he is granting him. The king sends to seek and to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: summon all the high barons of his land, and has ships and boats,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: cutters and barques sought out and equipped. With shields, with
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lances, with targes, and with knightly armour he has a hundred
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: ships filled and laden. The king makes so great a preparation to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: wage war that never had even Cesar or Alexander the like. He has
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: caused to be summoned and mustered all England and all Flanders,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Normandy, France, and Brittany, and all tribes, even as far as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the Spanish passes. Now were they about to put to sea when
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: messengers came from Greece, who stayed the expedition and kept
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: back the king and his men. With the messengers who came was John,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: who was well worthy to be believed, for he was witness and
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: messenger of nought that was not true and that he did not know
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: for certain. The messengers were high men of Greece, who were
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: seeking Cliges. They sought and asked for him until they found
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him at the court of the king, and they have said to him: "God
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: save you, sire. On the part of all the inhabitants of your
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: empire, Greece is yielded and Constantinople given to you,
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: because of the right that you have to it. Your uncle--as yet you
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: know it not--is dead of the grief that he had because he could
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: not find you. He had such grief that he lost his senses: never
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: afterwards did he either eat or drink, and he died a madman. Fair
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: sire, return now hence, for all your barons send for you. Greatly
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: do they desire and ask for you, for they will to make you
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: emperor." Many there were who were blithe at this message, but on
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: the other hand there were man who would gladly have left their
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: homes, and who would have been mightily pleased if the host had
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: set out for Greece. But the expedition has fallen through
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: altogether, for the king sends away his men, and the host
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: disperses and returns home. But Cliges hastens and prepares
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: himself, for his will is to return into Greece, no care has he to
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: tarry longer. He has prepared himself, and has taken leave of the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: king and all his friends: he takes Fenice with him, and they
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: depart and do not rest till they are in Greece, where men receive
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: him with great joy, as they ought to do their lord, and give him
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his lady-love to wife; they crown them both together. He has made
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: his lady-love his wife, but he calls her lady-love and dame, nor
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: does she for that cease to be cherished as his lady-love, and she
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: cherishes him every whit as much as one ought to cherish one's
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: lover. And each day their love grew; never did he mistrust her
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: nor chide her for aught. She was never kept in seclusion, as
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: those who came after her later have been kept (for henceforth
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: there was no emperor who was not afraid lest his wife might
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: deceive him, when he heard tell how Fenice deceived Alis, first
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: by the potion that he drank and then by the other treason). For
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: which reason the empress, whoever she be, be she of never so
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: splendid and high degree, is guarded in Constantinople; for the
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: emperor trusts her not as long as he remembers Fenice.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: Here ends the work of Chretien.
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century

text: THE END
title: Cliges: A Romance
author: Chrétien, de Troyes, active 12th century
